DataElement.preferredName: Patient Chemotherapy Personal Medical History Platinum-Based Taxane Compound Therapeutic Procedure Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the patient's personal medical history, an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced, including a prior platinum-based or taxane-based therapy, anticancer drugs that inhibit cancer cell growth by stopping cell division, to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic proces.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Chemotherapy Personal Medical History Platinum-Based Taxane Compound Therapeutic Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a patient's personal medical history, an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced, including a prior platinum-based or taxane-based therapy, anticancer drugs that inhibit cancer cell growth by stopping cell division, to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic proces.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Platinum-Based Taxane Compound Therapeutic Procedure Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: Derived from or containing platinum.:Anticancer drugs that inhibit cancer cell growth by stopping cell division. Also called antimitotic or antimicrotubule agents or mitotic inhibitors.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A type of drug that blocks cell growth by stopping mitosis (cell division). Taxanes interfere with microtubules (cellular structures that help move chromosomes during mitosis). They are used to treat cancer. A taxane is a type of mitotic inhibitor and a type of antimicrotubule agent.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Prior platinum based and/or p
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior platinum based and/or paclitaxel based therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had previous therapy with anthracyclines, taxanes, or trastuzumab for any malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior allergic reaction to carboplatin, cisplatin or paclitaxel

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had previous treatment with weekly paclitaxel for recurrent or persistent disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had previous therapy with anthracyclines or taxanes for any malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received weekly Paclitaxel for recurrent or persistent disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient complete a course of standard neoadjuvant chemotherapy consisting of an anthracycline and/or taxane-based regimen

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient receive a minimum of 12 weeks of standard neoadjuvant chemotherapy consisting of an anthracycline and/or taxane-based regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have previous therapy with anthracyclines, taxanes, carboplatin, trastuzumab, or other HER2 targeted therapies for any malignancy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient complete at least 6 cycles of neoadjuvant or adjuvant chemotherapy containing anthracyclines, taxanes, or the combination of both

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have any previous therapy with anthracyclines or taxanes for any malignancy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient receive a minimum of 8 weeks of standard neoadjuvant chemotherapy consisting of an anthracycline and/or taxane-based regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient previously receive treatment on AOST0331 or CCG7921 (also known as INT0133 and POG9351) OR did patient receive upfront therapies, which included cisplatin, with or without ifosfamide?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior carboplatin/gemcitabine or cisplatin/gemcitabine?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior weekly paclitaxel in a platinum-resistant setting?
